experience: You and Bart both know Dale Drew, Richard Pollack, and 23 others
Chief Management Officer, SVP & VP of Business Development

Responsible for the company’s growth and the delivery team. Created relationships with executive level contacts within utility companies (cooperatives, municipals, and investor owned utilities) to build community-owned solar energy solutions for regions, towns, and cities. Strategized up-market mobility for the company and supported other regional Business Development staff in their respective territories. Bolstered internal infrastructure (processes, policies, tools, etc.) and operational efficiency to prepare the company for the next stage of growth.•  Growth from start-up stage to $250M+ valuation•  2014 Inc 500 List of Fastest Growing Companies - #194 out of 500 nationally•  Average of 500% year over year growth from 2013 to 2015•  Maintained CEC’s position as the nation’s #1 provider of community solar solutions•  Led the creation of a pipeline of over 200 MW of opportunities with utilities•  More than doubled state coverage for CEC •  Helped identify & research over 1,000 high probability utility prospects •  Developed a “land grab” process to systematically reach out to prospects (hitting over 90%+ coverage)• Worked with the CEO to create & refine outreach strategies (G&T program, land grab effort, IOU “ownership” model, self-generation leading to business erosion approach, decreased liability for utilities, etc.)•  Created reports for Board of Directors, management staff, and department to track progress •  Created a brand new SharePoint library for Business Development and migrated the entire directory structure •  Contributions to the Business Development process map and process documentation•  Built strategic relationships that will result in future opportunities, including large utilities and G&Ts•  Implementation of Project Plans for all facility development initiatives•  Led negotiations with utility partners

Led the management team & executive committee and directed a team of 120 staff members and 30 full-time contractors in sales, finance, engineering, delivery, QA, design, PMO, IT, and HR. Oversaw all day-to-day operations for the company.  Drove corporate vision/mission. Managed strategic relationships, contractual matters, legal matters, and corporate decisions. Full responsibility for P&L, cash management and sales management. Set strategy for up-market mobility for the company. Managed organic growth and new business development. Implemented processes and procedures across the company to allow for managed growth and rapid expansion. • Achieved a 300% revenue increase and an 800% increase in net operating income over four years while relying strictly on new sales revenue (no outside capital).• Captured over $50 million in new business, personally negotiating all aspects of major contracts with Computer Sciences Corporation (CSC), Accenture, US. Department of Labor, Veteran’s Affairs Financial Services Center (VA-FSC), and an organization representing the World Trade Center.• Delivered exponential growth, increasing deal values from $250K-$1.5M to $5M-$20M by entering the federal and state marketplace and moving up-market. • Fueled additional revenue growth with new contracts valued at $3M - 2009, $10M - 2010 and $24M - 2011.• Drove 35% improvement in services margins through greater efficiency and an increased services rate.• Created nearly $150M in new business for partners CSC and Accenture.• Avoided several million dollars in contingent liability by successfully settling three legal disputes of significance by directly leading mediation and negotiation efforts.• Delivered $2M savings in first three years by reducing expenses, renegotiating contracts, and reallocating work to internal staff.• Partnered with venture capitalists, investment bankers, and the owner to determine the company’s valuation for an exit strategy.

Directed business startup, infrastructure and organizational development efforts. Led all strategic planning initiatives and created a financial plan to reach sales and revenue goals. Directly negotiated 100% of the revenue-generating deals and contracts with partners, customers and prospects. Managed cash flow, with P&L responsibility, and oversaw client relationships and engagements. Led and directed all staff, contractors and sales consultants. • Achieved 100% of operational goals in just 12 months through a structured Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and implementation process. • Created high-quality enterprise product, managing contractor group’s product development and QA practices. • Became a globally recognized market leader in the NICU / pediatric space, shifting from R&D investments into profitability, by successfully promoting “Crib Notes” across the industry. • Achieved interoperability with enterprise EMR systems by creating HL7 interfaces. i.e. Cerner, Epic, Eclipsys, Misys, and McKesson.• Closed hundreds of thousands of dollars worth of software development, service implementation and support and maintenance contracts with hospitals/pediatric groups.• Awarded “Entrepreneurial Company of the Year” at Frost & Sullivan’s Growth Innovation & Leadership Conference. Crib Notes was cultivated into an internationally recognized product platform in less than 12 months and became the most operationally efficient EMR company in the space.

Led and directed teams of up to 30 people on long-term projects including business analysts, technical architects, project managers, developers and QA staff. Personally designed effort-driven and task-driven project plans for individual client efforts. Drove the full SDLC across several client organizations. Served as primary point of contact and primary escalation point for clients, rapidly resolving issues and conflicts within projects. Ensured work remained within the budget. Representative client engagements included: • Third Millennium Healthcare Systems (CareMedic) with Allina Health: Built and delivered a web-based claims processing system and revenue cycle management system as well as subsequent product development work.• Per-Se Technologies: Moved antiquated product architecture to a modern platform across two products: ORSOS and ANSOS.  • Meridium: Delivered supplementary development and architecture services to augment the existing development team.• FMG: Modernized an EMR product.• Grand Rounds Software: Laid out architectural and technical plans to convert “Crib Notes” from an Apple Macintosh platform to an enterprise-enabled PC platform. • Paragon / FCG: Coordinated development efforts between two offshore development centers (Vietnam and India).  • Paragon / FCG: Obtained CMMi Level 5 certification in two software development centers.

recommendations: July 24, 2013, Bart was a client of Phil’s

Bart is a problem solver. I worked with him in the resolution of two disputes with customers that were not problems of his making but for which he led the team that generated the solutions. Bart did a superb job managing the situation and was extremely well organized. He paid attention to detail but never lost sight of the big picture. In both matters, he did an outstanding job negotiating the multi-party situations (despite complex dynamics) which resulted in very favorable outcomes.

April 5, 2013, Bart worked with Bo in the same group

Bart is an accomplished leader who is highly energetic, very adaptive to new trends in the industry and a great motivator of the teams he is managing. He was instrumental in building FCG's offshore capabilities and delivering projects on time and within budget. In my opinion, Bart's greatest skill is his ability to understand the needs of the client and manage the scope of a project. He understands how to balance the technical needs of a development team and the business priorities of the clients. His ability to lead high-powered technical teams towards the successful completion of projects makes him a great asset for any organization.

summary: Known for delivering results where strategy meets execution, my expertise includes business leadership, rapid corporate growth, operational efficiency, sales & marketing, deal negotiations, emerging technologies, and effective P&L management at companies ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s.I am particularly skilled at growth acceleration, company turn arounds, and corporate transformations. I have enjoyed the challenges of repositioning businesses and optimizing opportunities to achieve organic growth, accelerate business development, and prepare for M&A events. Throughout my career I have successfully led and built technology companies focusing on software development, healthcare solutions, oil & gas, and, most recently, solar energy. I thrive in environments where I can deliver targeted revenue and profit growth and shareholder value even in complex, mission-impossible situations.Projects we can discuss include transforming a product or company, achieving rapid growth within a specific market segment, revolutionizing or optimizing business strategies, embracing disruptive trends across industries (such as the booming growth of renewable energy and the impact of solar & wind technologies for utilities), driving revenue, managing rapid growth, tools for streamlining business tasks, ways to create positive & lasting change, and others. The general theme I tend to follow is growth & transformation, both personally and professionally. Please feel free to reach out to me directly via LinkedIn mail or send me an email at bart.rupert@easycleanenergy.com.
name: Bart Rupert
title: Chief Information Officer - Clean Energy Collective
